(OOC: I hope I got everything. This is like writing 4 or 5 posts in one.  )=



INSIDE THE ARK:

> Inside the Ark, Tucson makes his way toward Rodimus's=
 position, while
keeping close tabs on the signal he's able to work with, a=
s faint as it is.
He also picks up on Rodimus as he now approaches him quie=
tly.
>
> " I take it you've picked up on Nightrazor's trail. Well, he's che=
cked
himself in but he won't check himself out. His signatures are fluctuat=
ing,
which means he's trying to recalibrate his systems. Hense he's also
di=
stracted. Good time to apprehend him. All right, I'm going in, but before
I=
 do, I used my last pair of stasis cuffs, would you by chance have another
=
I could borrow?"

<NEW>

Tuscon is able to quickly reach Rodimus, who is cu=
rrently in robot mode,
looking around with his weapon drawn. =93I heard him=
 in here.=94 Rodimus said as
he continued to look around, his high beams il=
luminating the other wise dark
room.

The light shines across the fallen bo=
dies of the much older and much larger
Autobots and Decepticons. They were =
all positioned in the front chamber of
the ship, strewn between the door le=
ading out of the ship and the main
control station that the Autobots would =
one day, millions of years from now,
turn into the control center for their=
 base. However at the moment the room
was, save for the lights brought by R=
odimus,  completely dark the front door
of the Ark finally able to close, s=
ealing out the light from the outside,
and hopefully the damage that would =
come from the outside.

Then there was the sound of something being thrown =
through the air, and
Rodimus=92 light went out and as far as Tuscon, Rodimu=
s and Straightshot could
tell, the room went completely silent and they cou=
ldn=92t even hear the sound
of their own voice - even Tuscon=92s radar/sona=
r seemed to be down.


> <OLD>
>
> =93Nightrazor, LEAVE THAT PLACE INMEDEAT=
LY=94said Hydras by comlink whine he
fire back to Bantos and Torca

<NEW>

=
There was a short message back from Nightrazor. =93I=92m working on it. I h=
ave
to get past these Maximals first.=94 There was a pause and then a grunt=
,
=93Okay, I believe I have distracted them. I would appreciate some help
g=
etting the front door open again.=94 Nightrazor was of course talking about=

the main door of the Ark. It was the only thing that separated him from
fr=
eedom . . . that and that cursed wave that Tuscon was emitting.

ELSEWHERE =
IN THE ARK:

> Elita hide behind Ramulus but still she was peeking trying t=
o find out who
were the fallen ones...

<NEW>

Ramulus looked back at Elita=
 again and then down at the figures at his feet.
He bent down to examine th=
em, running a small scanner on them. It was Santon
and Bump, both laying th=
ere in a heap.

=93They are alive.=94 Ramulus said with a slight hitch in h=
is voice. =93But
barely. Weren=92t they supposed to be . . .=94

Ramulus=92=
 head snapped up as he looked at Elita, =93Come on, we have to get to
the M=
edbay, Quick!=94

Ramulus tapped a control activating his communication gea=
r, =93Tuscon, Rodimus
Santon and Bump are down. Weren=92t they suppose to b=
e . . .=94 he glanced at
Elita, =93. . . some where else?=94

> <OLD>
>
> P=
erceptor continue working fast trying to seal all acces to the sleeping
Aut=
obots and decepticons =93Legacy, we must find the way to seal the ARK!!! we=

have to keep out Hydras of the ark=94
>

<NEW>

Legacy nodded, =93The main=
 door to the Ark has been sealed. However with the
reapplication of Tuscon=
=92s wave emission getting main power online will prove
to be difficult. It=
 is possible to for Hydras to simply blast through. I may
be needed in the =
main room to protect the elder ones.=94 Legacy was talking
about the old Au=
tobots and Decepticons. =93I believe at the moment I am the
only one with a=
 working shield.=94

Legacy turned to leave, =93I will leave you to protect=
 the Ark as best you
can. I have set the control for tactile and verbal ope=
ration. You should be
able to operate it by touch.=94

MEANWHILE OUTSIDE TH=
E ARK:

> <OLD>
>
> Windlord keep the fire in Deepstrike  while Kup continu=
e to shooting
Scourge and the sweeps, he had a hard time doing that.

<NEW>=


Windlord and Kup kept firing up at the Predacons, theirs combined with To=
rca
and Leo II were lighting up the skies. Leo II=92s shot=92s along with K=
up=92s hit
Scourge on two sides, sending the hunter spinning in the air. He=
 was not
brought down so much as he received two terrible wounds which forc=
ed him to,
at least temporarily, break off his attack.

Meanwhile Deepstryk=
e slowly made his way towards the Ark, Windlord=92s attacks
able to slow hi=
m down as he had to maneuver around the attacks, or allow his
armored chass=
is to absorb them. But being a gun unit had its advantages as
he also retur=
ned fire on Windlord.

> <OLD>
>
> Uproar growls as he addresses Cyclonus w=
hile leaping into the air on
strong legs.
>
> "BANZAIIII!"
>
> He raises hi=
s left arm to attempt a powerful claw swipe.

<NEW>

As Uproar leaped up to=
 try to meet Cyclonus in the air, the elegantly
graceful craft that was Cyc=
lonus began to spin in the air, angling away from
the nasty claws that Upro=
ar was swinging at him, spinning wing over wing to
do it. It was as if Cycl=
onus were some sort of dancer, or an agile bird of
flight. Behind him his b=
oosters flared brightly as picked up speed!

Even as he moved though, at th=
e top of the jet a twin cannon turret spun,
orienting on Uproar and then wi=
th a pause for target acquisition they opened
up with twin plumes of corusc=
ating power!

> <OLD>
>
> Meanwhile, Quickstride calibrates his large blast=
 cannon, and takes
careful aim at Waspinator. He chuckles under his breath.=

>
> " Bye bye BUGGIE!"
>
> His finger pulls back on the trigger, as he now=
 attempts to shoot
Waspinator down.

<NEW>

Waspinator is not nearly so agi=
le as Cyclonus in the air, nor is he built as
durable. But what he lacks in=
 these two qualities he makes up in tenacity
and just foolish luck. Buzzing=
, much like a real wasp he flew in, dodging
one blast, and then another, un=
til a third one catches him in a wing sending
Waspinator rocketing through =
the air like a cannon ball.

=93Me Waspinator am tired of Maxibots beating =
on him.=94 Waspinator said as he
was flung through the air. =93Waspinator T=
ERRORIZE!=94 he said as he shifted
into his transmetaled form, that of a fi=
ghter jet. The battle was far from
over as he righted himself and came back=
 at Quickstride, guns blazing!

Meanwhile as Hydras and Inferno arrived at =
the door to the Ark, they found
it closed, the massive doors clicking as th=
ey came to a stop. Getting into
the Ark would not be that easy. In fact it =
was to be much more difficult as
Quicksilver, Airhammer and Noctorro, three=
 of the Maximal Fuzors, came
flying in from one side, firing their weapons =
at Hydras and Inferno as
Bantor, the other more land bound Fuzor leaped in =
to attack Hydras again!


AND SOME DISTANCE AWAY:

> <OLD>
>
> Rat Trap gri=
ns.
>
> "Oooh yeah, good thinkn'. I dunno if I like this place, but it's be=
tter
than havn' those airheads blastn' the fuzz off my tail end."
>
> Toget=
her they walk into the dense overgrowth, exploring its parameters
with what=
 little light comes from Night Shift's high beams.

<NEW>

As some of the a=
ncient forests actually stretched across much of the North
American contine=
nt, the =91parameters=92 of the forest stretch out for as far as
the optic =
can see. The area inside the forest is not as densely overgrown as
one migh=
t imagine. With the canopy of trees over head blocking most of the
direct s=
unlight, at ground level things are fairly clear, save for large and
leafy =
growths of ferns or other wild plants.

That does not mean that the ground =
is flat, as large tree roots, stones and
broken ground break up the ground =
making it treacherous for the unaware,
making anything close to four wheel =
travel, even for those of Cybertronian
descent, extremely difficult and haz=
ardess. There is even the occasional
large fallen tree here and there; sign=
s that not even the tall spires of the
forest are immune to the ravages of =
time and unforeseen occurrence.

In robot rode, Nightshift and Rat Trap can=
 still hear the movements of
animals all around them, birds still occasiona=
lly fly up or make odd noises
as they pass. There is the occasional foot pr=
int and the obvious sounds of
passage of large animals, some perhaps larger=
 than a school bus.

Should these two desire to travel back the scene of Hy=
dras=92 tower, it might
be possible, and maybe even safe from the sweeps th=
at had chased them into
the forest, but that does not mean it will be easy =
or quick.

(TAG)

Preston

--bcaec50162b1b6d6f2049fddf1f2
